page.title: 08Kimbolton - Buildings
page.content: Kimbolton's present attraction for tourists springs from the fact that this once prosperous market-town, while other towns expanded, virtually stood still after the mid-nineteenth century. Buildings that might have been cleared, remained standing for a century almost by accident, until today, when they are jealously preserved. Typically,{C18 and C19 facades mask {medieval timber-framed houses - } notably at : No. 4 High St.,a C15 Wealden house now a garage: No. 19 High St., a C13 house, now a restaurant: No. 2 Thrapston Road, 3 C16 houses, now one house: No.9 East St.,a C15 house, still a house: No.30 East St., possibly a guild-hall, now a house: Nos. 31,33 High St., and Nos. 5,7 East St., are distinguished C18 houses.
